abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Accountability for Decentralization in the Social Sectors
            Technical Assistance Project, is to strengthen
            results-oriented, and participatory planning, including
            monitoring and evaluation, emphasizing on decentralized
            social programs at the Ministry for Women and Social
            Development - MIMDES. The first component will improve the
            quality of social policies and programs, taking into account
            the issue of decentralization, whether already
            decentralized, or subject to future decentralization;
            whereas the second component will implement Performance
            Agreements and Accreditation of social sectors, by ensuring
            adequate decentralization of the social programs, through
            the design, and implementation of the instruments for the
            accreditation process, particularly for social programs;
            implementing performance, and/or management agreements
            (PAS); and, by monitoring and evaluating budget transfers to
            sub-national governments. The third component aims at
            improving monitoring and evaluation (M&E) in the Social
            Sectors. The purpose of this component is to build M&E
            capacity by strengthening existing monitoring instruments,
            and establishing new ones as necessary, and strengthening
            analytical capacity among the different actors engaged in
            the implementation process.
